intro: Turn the LED on and OFF using two different pushbuttons

steps: 1.Place the LED and a 220 ohm resistor on the breadboard
2.Connect using breadboarding jumper wire from GND to the negative rail of the breadboard
3.Connect using breadboarding jumper wire from negative rail to the negative side of the LED
4.Connect a jumper wire from D2 to the resistor side on the positive side of the LED

build.steps: Connect two pushbuttons and two 10K ohm resistors on the breadboard

steps: 1.Connect using a jumper wire from top negative rail to the bottom negative rail of the breaboard
2.Connect a jumper wire from 5V to the positive rail of the breadboard
3.Connect a jumper wire from the positive rail of the breadboard to one side of button1
4.Connect a jumper wire from the positive rail of the breadboard to one side of button2
1.Connect using a jumper wire from D10 to one side of button1
2.Connect using a jumper wire from D13 to one side of button2
3.Run the project and press button1 and observe and press it again and observe
4.Press button2 then observe and press it again and observe
5. Now press button1 and press button2 and observe.
